name: Joshua Rifkin
description:
'''Joshua Rifkin''' (born April 22, 1944) is an American [[Conducting|conductor]], pianist, and [[musicologist]]. He is currently a professor of music at [[Boston University]]. As a performer, he has recorded music by composers from [[Antoine Busnois]] to [[Silvestre Revueltas]]; as a scholar he has published research on composers from the [[Renaissance]] to the 20th century.

Rifkin is known among classical musicians for his theory that most of [[Bach]]'s choral works were sung with only [[OVPP|one singer per choral line]]. Rifkin argued that "so long as we define 'chorus' in the conventional modern sense, then Bach's chorus with few exceptions simply did not exist." 

He is best known among the public for helping to revive [[ragtime]] in the 1970s by recording three albums of [[Scott Joplin]]'s works for [[Nonesuch Records]].
